revision.comment: move lang= to 1= in {{was fwotd}}; move lang= to 1= in {{IPA}}
revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== {{was fwotd|nci|2014|April|12}} ===Etymology=== From {{compound|nci|xōchitl|micqui|t1=flower|t2=one that has died}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|[ʃoː.t͡ʃiˈmik.ki]}} ===Noun=== {{nci-noun|a|xōchimicqui|pl=xōchimicqueh}} # a [[sacrificial]] [[victim]], especially a [[prisoner of war]] offered in [[sacrifice]] #* '''1571''', [[w:Alonso de Molina|Alonso de Molina]], ''[[w:Vocabulario en lengua castellana y mexicana y mexicana y castellana|Vocabulario en lengua castellana y mexicana y mexicana y castellana]]'', f. 160r. col. 2. #*: '''Xochimicque'''. captiuos enguerra, los quales eran / ſacrficados y muertos, delante de los idolos. #*:: '''Xochimicque'''. those captured in war; which were [later] sacrificed and killed before the idols. ===References=== * {{cite-book|author=[[w:Alonso de Molina|Alonso de Molina]]|year=2008|title=[[w:Vocabulario en lengua castellana y mexicana y mexicana y castellana|Vocabulario en lengua castellana y mexicana y mexicana y castellana]] (1571)|publisher=Editorial Porrúa|page=160}} [[Category:nci:Death]] [[Category:nci:People]] [[Category:nci:Religion]] [[Category:nci:War]]
